This was probably my favorite tapas bar in the city and was a great place to bring parents when they were in town and wanted to try a little bit of everything.  They have a wide variety of cheese plates, assorted meat plates, and other unique tapas.  This was where I fell in love with croquetas, and I haven't had a better one since.  They have the perfect texture and served hot.The outdoor seating is beautiful because it is situated on one of the prettier streets in the city and it is less crowded and bumbling that inside.  The inside is really crowded and you may have to wait awhile to be seated, which is made more difficult because there is ZERO standing space inside the restaurant.  I suggest going when its nice out and eating outdoors.
